title: Detect import conflicts before build
description: When a module defines a symbol that conflicts with an imported module's exports (e.g., defining string-prefix? while importing :std/srfi/13), the build fails with a cryptic 'Bad binding; import conflict' error. A pre-build lint check could statically detect these conflicts by comparing each file's local definitions against its imports' exported symbols, reporting exactly which symbols conflict and from which modules.
use_case: When adding new imports to a module that already has local definitions, or when refactoring to use standard library functions that might clash with existing local definitions.
example_scenario: util.ss defined string-prefix? and string-trim-both locally. format.ss imported both :std/srfi/13 and ./util. Build failed with 'Bad binding; import conflict' for string-prefix?. Had to debug by reading both modules and figuring out the overlap manually.
